Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance (IOPS), and redundancy. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure Disk Storage.
Design the storage architecture, including disk types (Standard HDD, Standard SSD, Premium SSD, Ultra Disk), disk sizes, and integration with virtual machines.
Create and configure Azure Disk Storage in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure proper disk type and size selection based on workload requirements.
Attach the provisioned disks to the appropriate virtual machines. Configure disk settings such as caching and encryption.
Enable encryption for Azure Disk Storage using Azure Disk Encryption or server-side encryption with customer-managed keys. Configure access control policies.
Set up Azure Backup or other backup solutions to ensure data protection and recovery options for Azure Disk Storage.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track disk performance metrics such as IOPS, latency, and throughput. Configure alerts for disk health issues.
Perform testing to validate storage performance, redundancy, and failover mechanisms. Ensure the setup meets the required specifications.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide detailed instructions for managing and troubleshooting Azure Disk Storage.
Ensure the storage setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Analyze disk usage and capacity trends to ensure sufficient storage availability. Plan for scaling or resizing disks as needed.
Regularly audit access permissions for Azure Disk Storage to ensure compliance with security policies. Remove unnecessary or outdated permissions.
Conduct failover and recovery tests to validate disaster recovery plans for Azure Disk Storage. Ensure data can be restored in case of failure.
Review and update storage policies, including retention, encryption, and access policies, to align with organizational requirements and compliance standards.
Analyze disk performance metrics and implement optimizations, such as resizing or changing disk types, to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Perform security incident drills to prepare for potential breaches or vulnerabilities in Azure Disk Storage. Validate response protocols.
Evaluate Azure Disk Storage SLAs to ensure compliance with performance and availability metrics. Address any deviations with Microsoft support.
Develop and execute plans for upgrading Azure Disk Storage to newer versions or higher performance tiers as needed.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Disk Storage features, best practices, and security measures.
Regularly validate the integrity and usability of disk snapshots to ensure they can be used for restoration or cloning purposes.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Disk Storage performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
